Breaking in a new pair of Doc Martens in less than a week can be challenging and a pain-filled experience; they can leave you with nasty blisters and sore feet that take weeks to heal. However, there are several tips that can help you expedite the process. In this post, I will show you how to break in Doc Martens quickly and as pain-free as possible. Key Takeaways Choosing the right kind of Dr Marten shoe is important to your breaking-in journey and how much work you’re willing to put into the process. However, learning how to break in Doc Martens, no matter the type of shoe can be done. My top advice is to invest in the right kind of leather conditioner and to wear the shoes, even around the house, as much as possible, and stuff your boots when you’re not wearing them. Keep reading to find out the rest of my tried and true methods on breaking in Doc Martens. And if you don’t want to read, keep scrolling to watch the video version. In This ArticleChoose The Right LeatherTips for Breaking in Dr MartensHow We Chose VideoWhy Trust UsFinal Verdict @OriginallyKamara Choose the Right Type of Leather The first way, which is the quickest way, to learn how to break in of Dr Martens is ensuring you buy the right pair. Doc Martens offers different types of leather, but each of them takes different periods of time to break into compared to similar boots like Solovair . If you want to break into a pair of Doc Martens as quickly as possible, (in my experience within a week or less)I definitely recommend buying soft leather Doc Martens or some vegan docs. Soft Leather Doc Martens The soft leather is softer than the traditional leather and makes it 10 times easier to break into. They fit like any other Docs, but the leather comes very soft, meaning it has less rigid structure. The soft leather Doc Martens to get are the Nappa Leather, the Virginia leather, or the Pisa leather. You can break into these in about two, maybe three days, and if you’re very ambitious, you can probably break it in your first try. Wear these boots around the house and with thick socks for the best results, avoid heat or leather softener as these types don’t need to be broken down more. Investing in a good shoe tree that can stretch the leather for you overnight is a game changer as well, especially if you have wider or larger feet. @OriginallyKamara Vegan Doc Martens When it comes to the vegan docs, they’re made with synthetic material, so you don’t have to worry about breaking into anything because it’s not leather, they don’t have the same tough structure as real leather. The only thing to keep in mind, that I’ve noticed with vegan docs is they’re a little bit narrow. I would size up if you’re in between sizes and also get a shoe tree to quickly stretch the shoe. However, for the most part, as soon as you put them on, they’re very easy to break into. Tips for Breaking in Smooth Leather Doc Martens What if you don’t want any of the vegan or smooth leather options? If you still want a pair of smooth leather, original Dr. Martens and want to learn how to break in Doc Martens into them as quickly as possible, follow my favorite tested tips. @OriginallyKamara Use Leather Conditioner or Softener Once you get those coveted pair of Doc Martens, the first thing you need to do is use a trusted leather conditioner or softener to make the break-in period as easy as possible. My favorite is the Dr Martens Wonder Balsam, this is a great product to help soften the leather (which makes it more comfortable to wear) and keep your new boots looking brand new for decades to come. Not only is this the brand-associated softener but the setup is ideal as well. The jar comes with a sponge, separate from the balm, which makes storage and use both easy and beginner-friendly. All you have to do is apply a small amount of conditioner on your boots and rub it into the leather. If you don’t want to use the Wonder Balsam can also use leather oil or other balms to help protect the leather. Apply Heat The second thing to consider when learning how to break in doc martens is to apply heat. I don’t recommend using a hair dryer because it can give very confusing results and take a lot more effort Instead, I recommend using a small space heater. For the best results, and the cheapest electricity bill, heat up a small room and then leave your Doc Martens in there for about 10 to 15 minutes then wear them around the house. This will soften the leather and make it more pliable, allowing your boots to mold into the shape of your feet more quickly, easily reducing sore feet and potential blisters. You can also take some time to massage the boots on key sensitive areas, like the back of the heels or around the toe box to soften the leather even more. Wear Thick Socks The next thing to consider is wearing thick socks. For the first couple of times wearing your docs, wear thick socks, or you can double socks or provide a cushion for your feet and protect them from rubbing or getting any blisters that may occur in the breaking-in period. Top Tip: Investing in a pair of Merino wool or cushioned hiking socks (extra padding around the ankle and bottom of the foot) can make the process easier as well. You could also splurge out on insoles. Wear Your Boots as Much as Possible Next is to wear your boots as much as possible. It seems like a no-brainer but it really helps to wear them constantly for about a week. The more you wear them, the more quickly they will break in. Start by wearing them for short periods of time and gradually increase the duration. You can wear them around the house, to run errands, or to work. Try to build up to a thousand steps a day in your docs, but also keep in mind, if your feet start to hurt, please take them off and rest for the day. You don’t want your feet to hurt or start to blister, which will hinder how quickly you can break them in. Stuff Your Boots When Not Wearing Them The last thing you can do when exploring how to break in dr martens is to stuff your boots. When you’re not wearing your docs or any alternative, you’ll want to stuff them with newspapers, or if you have a shoe tree, that also works great. If using newspaper make sure to use a lot, the more overstuffed the better stretch you might be able to achieve overnight. I would recommend using this method for at least a week to get the intended results. Shoe trees are my personal favorite and go-to method, as you can adjust the amount of pressure you want to put on the leather. This will make the boots hold their shape when you’re not wearing them, so once you put them on, they fit perfectly. @OriginallyKamara How We Chose In crafting the guide on “How to Break in Doc Martens,” my approach was meticulous and centered around getting your new docs to be easily wearable and comfortable as quickly as possible. Breaking in a new pair of Doc Martens in less than a week can be challenging and a pain-filled experience; they can leave you with nasty blisters and sore feet that take weeks to heal. However, there are several tips that can help you expedite the process. In this post, I will show you how to break in Doc Martens quickly and as pain-free as possible.

Key Takeaways

Choosing the right kind of Dr Marten shoe is important to your breaking-in journey and how much work you’re willing to put into the process. However, learning how to break in Doc Martens, no matter the type of shoe can be done. My top advice is to invest in the right kind of leather conditioner and to wear the shoes, even around the house, as much as possible, and stuff your boots when you’re not wearing them.

Keep reading to find out the rest of my tried and true methods on breaking in Doc Martens. And if you don’t want to read, keep scrolling to watch the video version.

In This Article

  1. Choose The Right Leather
  2. Tips for Breaking in Dr Martens
  3. How We Chose
  4. Video
  5. Why Trust Us
  6. Final Verdict

Choose the Right Type of Leather

The first way, which is the quickest way, to learn how to break in of Dr Martens is ensuring you buy the right pair. Doc Martens offers different types of leather, but each of them takes different periods of time to break into compared to similar boots like Solovair . If you want to break into a pair of Doc Martens as quickly as possible, (in my experience within a week or less)I definitely recommend buying soft leather Doc Martens or some vegan docs.

Soft Leather Doc Martens

The soft leather is softer than the traditional leather and makes it 10 times easier to break into. They fit like any other Docs, but the leather comes very soft, meaning it has less rigid structure. The soft leather Doc Martens to get are the Nappa Leather, the Virginia leather, or the Pisa leather. You can break into these in about two, maybe three days, and if you’re very ambitious, you can probably break it in your first try.

Wear these boots around the house and with thick socks for the best results, avoid heat or leather softener as these types don’t need to be broken down more. Investing in a good shoe tree that can stretch the leather for you overnight is a game changer as well, especially if you have wider or larger feet.

Vegan Doc Martens

When it comes to the vegan docs, they’re made with synthetic material, so you don’t have to worry about breaking into anything because it’s not leather, they don’t have the same tough structure as real leather. The only thing to keep in mind, that I’ve noticed with vegan docs is they’re a little bit narrow. I would size up if you’re in between sizes and also get a shoe tree to quickly stretch the shoe. However, for the most part, as soon as you put them on, they’re very easy to break into.

Tips for Breaking in Smooth Leather Doc Martens

What if you don’t want any of the vegan or smooth leather options? If you still want a pair of smooth leather, original Dr. Martens and want to learn how to break in Doc Martens into them as quickly as possible, follow my favorite tested tips.

Use Leather Conditioner or Softener

Once you get those coveted pair of Doc Martens, the first thing you need to do is use a trusted leather conditioner or softener to make the break-in period as easy as possible.

My favorite is the Dr Martens Wonder Balsam, this is a great product to help soften the leather (which makes it more comfortable to wear) and keep your new boots looking brand new for decades to come. Not only is this the brand-associated softener but the setup is ideal as well. The jar comes with a sponge, separate from the balm, which makes storage and use both easy and beginner-friendly.

All you have to do is apply a small amount of conditioner on your boots and rub it into the leather. If you don’t want to use the Wonder Balsam can also use leather oil or other balms to help protect the leather.

Apply Heat

The second thing to consider when learning how to break in doc martens is to apply heat. I don’t recommend using a hair dryer because it can give very confusing results and take a lot more effort

Instead, I recommend using a small space heater. For the best results, and the cheapest electricity bill, heat up a small room and then leave your Doc Martens in there for about 10 to 15 minutes then wear them around the house. This will soften the leather and make it more pliable, allowing your boots to mold into the shape of your feet more quickly, easily reducing sore feet and potential blisters. You can also take some time to massage the boots on key sensitive areas, like the back of the heels or around the toe box to soften the leather even more.

Wear Thick Socks

The next thing to consider is wearing thick socks. For the first couple of times wearing your docs, wear thick socks, or you can double socks or provide a cushion for your feet and protect them from rubbing or getting any blisters that may occur in the breaking-in period.

Top Tip: Investing in a pair of Merino wool or cushioned hiking socks (extra padding around the ankle and bottom of the foot) can make the process easier as well. You could also splurge out on insoles.

Wear Your Boots as Much as Possible

Next is to wear your boots as much as possible. It seems like a no-brainer but it really helps to wear them constantly for about a week. The more you wear them, the more quickly they will break in.

Start by wearing them for short periods of time and gradually increase the duration. You can wear them around the house, to run errands, or to work. Try to build up to a thousand steps a day in your docs, but also keep in mind, if your feet start to hurt, please take them off and rest for the day. You don’t want your feet to hurt or start to blister, which will hinder how quickly you can break them in.

Stuff Your Boots When Not Wearing Them

The last thing you can do when exploring how to break in dr martens is to stuff your boots.

When you’re not wearing your docs or any alternative, you’ll want to stuff them with newspapers, or if you have a shoe tree, that also works great. If using newspaper make sure to use a lot, the more overstuffed the better stretch you might be able to achieve overnight. I would recommend using this method for at least a week to get the intended results.

Shoe trees are my personal favorite and go-to method, as you can adjust the amount of pressure you want to put on the leather. This will make the boots hold their shape when you’re not wearing them, so once you put them on, they fit perfectly.

How We Chose

In crafting the guide on “How to Break in Doc Martens,” my approach was meticulous and centered around getting your new docs to be easily wearable and comfortable as quickly as possible. Here’s how I selected the products and methods:

Personal Testing and Experience: As a YouTuber and Dr. Martens enthusiast, I’ve personally tested various products and methods over the years. This first-hand experience has been invaluable in understanding what truly works.

Community Feedback: Engaging with my YouTube audience and the broader Dr. Martens community has provided a wealth of insights. I’ve incorporated suggestions and feedback from fellow enthusiasts to ensure the recommended methods are community-approved.

Quality and Effectiveness: Each product or method suggested in the article is chosen for its proven effectiveness and quality. I’ve researched and compared different approaches, only selecting those that provide the best results in breaking in Doc Martens.

Accessibility and Practicality: I understand that not everyone has access to specialized tools or products. Therefore, I’ve included methods that are practical and can be easily implemented by anyone, regardless of their resources.

Safety and Shoe Integrity: It’s crucial that the methods used do not damage the shoes. I’ve carefully considered the safety of each technique to ensure that while they expedite the breaking-in process, they also preserve the integrity of the boots.

My goal is to provide advice that’s not only effective but also accessible and safe. For more insights into footwear care, check out my other articles like Doc Martens vs Solovair – A Battle of 2 Iconic Boots.

Why You Should Trust Us

As a seasoned content creator and Dr. Martens aficionado, my insights into breaking in these iconic boots are rooted in years of hands-on experience and passion. My approach to this guide is not only theoretical but also born out of my extensive journey with different styles and types of Dr. Martens. From experimenting with various leather types to understanding the nuances of care and maintenance, my expertise is grounded in real-world usage and a deep appreciation for the brand.

Additionally, my consistent engagement with the Dr. Martens community through my YouTube channel has enriched my understanding, enabling me to offer advice that’s not just practical but also tailored to real user needs. Whether it’s styling tips or breaking-in methods, my recommendations are always aimed at enhancing your experience with these timeless boots. Check out my other comprehensive guides, like Doc Martens vs Solovair – A Battle of 2 Iconic Boots, for more insights into your footwear choices.

Final Verdict

Just remember, learning how to break in doc martens can take some time and patience, but it’s definitely possible to break into them in a week. Be gentle with your boots and take care of your feet to ensure a comfortable and successful breaking-in experience. Good luck!

The only thing to keep in mind, that I’ve noticed with vegan docs is they’re a little bit narrow. I would size up if you’re in between sizes and also get a shoe tree to quickly stretch the shoe. However, for the most part, as soon as you put them on, they’re very easy to break into.

Tips for Breaking in Smooth Leather Doc Martens

What if you don’t want any of the vegan or smooth leather options? If you still want a pair of smooth leather, original Dr. Martens and want to learn how to break in Doc Martens into them as quickly as possible, follow my favorite tested tips.

Use Leather Conditioner or Softener

Once you get those coveted pair of Doc Martens, the first thing you need to do is use a trusted leather conditioner or softener to make the break-in period as easy as possible.

My favorite is the Dr Martens Wonder Balsam, this is a great product to help soften the leather (which makes it more comfortable to wear) and keep your new boots looking brand new for decades to come. Not only is this the brand-associated softener but the setup is ideal as well. The jar comes with a sponge, separate from the balm, which makes storage and use both easy and beginner-friendly.

All you have to do is apply a small amount of conditioner on your boots and rub it into the leather. If you don’t want to use the Wonder Balsam can also use leather oil or other balms to help protect the leather.

Apply Heat

The second thing to consider when learning how to break in doc martens is to apply heat. I don’t recommend using a hair dryer because it can give very confusing results and take a lot more effort

Instead, I recommend using a small space heater. For the best results, and the cheapest electricity bill, heat up a small room and then leave your Doc Martens in there for about 10 to 15 minutes then wear them around the house. This will soften the leather and make it more pliable, allowing your boots to mold into the shape of your feet more quickly, easily reducing sore feet and potential blisters. You can also take some time to massage the boots on key sensitive areas, like the back of the heels or around the toe box to soften the leather even more.

Wear Thick Socks

The next thing to consider is wearing thick socks. For the first couple of times wearing your docs, wear thick socks, or you can double socks or provide a cushion for your feet and protect them from rubbing or getting any blisters that may occur in the breaking-in period.

Top Tip: Investing in a pair of Merino wool or cushioned hiking socks (extra padding around the ankle and bottom of the foot) can make the process easier as well. You could also splurge out on insoles.

Wear Your Boots as Much as Possible

Next is to wear your boots as much as possible. It seems like a no-brainer but it really helps to wear them constantly for about a week. The more you wear them, the more quickly they will break in.

Start by wearing them for short periods of time and gradually increase the duration. You can wear them around the house, to run errands, or to work. Try to build up to a thousand steps a day in your docs, but also keep in mind, if your feet start to hurt, please take them off and rest for the day. You don’t want your feet to hurt or start to blister, which will hinder how quickly you can break them in.

Stuff Your Boots When Not Wearing Them

The last thing you can do when exploring how to break in dr martens is to stuff your boots.

When you’re not wearing your docs or any alternative, you’ll want to stuff them with newspapers, or if you have a shoe tree, that also works great. If using newspaper make sure to use a lot, the more overstuffed the better stretch you might be able to achieve overnight. I would recommend using this method for at least a week to get the intended results.

Shoe trees are my personal favorite and go-to method, as you can adjust the amount of pressure you want to put on the leather. This will make the boots hold their shape when you’re not wearing them, so once you put them on, they fit perfectly.
